commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance create
commands.summary: Create a Virtual Instance for SAP solutions (VIS) resource.
commands.syntax:
az workloads sap-virtual-instance create --name
                                         --resource-group
                                         [--central-server-vm]
                                         [--configuration]
                                         [--environment {NonProd, Prod}]
                                         [--identity]
                                         [--location]
                                         [--managed-resources-network-access-type {Private, Public}]
                                         [--managed-rg-name]
                                         [--managed-rg-sa-name]
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                         [--sap-product {ECC, Other, S4HANA}]
                                         [--tags]
examples: az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --configuration <payload-file-path> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --configuration <payload-file-path> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-Identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --configuration <payload-file-path> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --configuration <payload-file-path> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --central-server-vm <virtual-machine-id> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --central-server-vm <virtual-machine-id> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}" --managed-rg-name <managed-rg-name> --managed-rg-sa-name <managed-rg-storage-account-name> --managed-resources-network-access-type <public/private>

az workloads sap-virtual-instance create -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --environment NonProd --sap-product s4hana --configuration <payload-file-path> --identity "{type:UserAssigned,userAssignedIdentities:{<managed-identity-resource-id>:{}}}"

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance delete
commands.summary: Delete a Virtual Instance for SAP solutions resource and its child resources, that is the associated Central Services Instance, Application Server Instances and Database Instance.
commands.syntax:
az workloads sap-virtual-instance delete [--ids]
                                         [--name]
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                         [--resource-group]
                                         [--subscription]
                                         [--yes]

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance list
commands.summary: List all Virtual Instances for SAP solutions resources in a Resource Group.

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance show
commands.summary: Show a Virtual Instance for SAP solutions resource.

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance start
commands.summary: Starts the SAP application, that is the Central Services instance and Application server instances.
commands.syntax:
az workloads sap-virtual-instance start [--ids]
                                        [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                        [--resource-group]
                                        [--sap-virtual-instance-name]
                                        [--start-vm {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                        [--subscription]

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance stop
commands.summary: Stops the SAP Application, that is the Application server instances and Central Services instance.
commands.syntax:
az workloads sap-virtual-instance stop [--deallocate-vm {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                       [--ids]
                                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                       [--resource-group]
                                       [--sap-virtual-instance-name]
                                       [--soft-stop-timeout-seconds]
                                       [--subscription]

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance update
commands.summary: Update a Virtual Instance for SAP solutions (VIS) resource.
commands.syntax:
az workloads sap-virtual-instance update [--identity]
                                         [--ids]
                                         [--managed-resources-network-access-type {Private, Public}]
                                         [--name]
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                         [--resource-group]
                                         [--subscription]
                                         [--tags]
examples: az workloads sap-virtual-instance update -g <resource-group-name> -n <vis-name> --tags tag1=test1 tag2=test2

commands.name: az workloads sap-virtual-instance wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
